Dynamical systems have memory

Last updated on May 18, 2021

Dynamical systems, both continuous-state and finite-state ones, exhibit memory. This is due to the fact that the current location in state space is influenced by all previous locations. Recurrent neural networks use this memory in resolving short-term dependencies.

Resources

  • https://www.ai.rug.nl/minds/uploads/LN_NN_RUG.pdf
